definition[0]: to keep changing between two extreme amounts or limits
example[0]: The stock market is oscillating wildly at the moment.
example[1]: His income oscillated between £1,500 and £2,000 a month.
definition[1]: to keep changing between one feeling or attitude and another
example[2]: Her attitude towards me oscillated between friendship and hostility.
definition[2]: to move backwards and forwards in a regular way
example[3]: The needle on the dial began to oscillate.
definition[3]: if an electric current oscillates, it changes direction very regularly and very frequently
definition[4]: to move regularly between two limits or states
example[4]: The trade balance used to oscillate between surplus and deficit.
